isis.stitle: POWER STEERING PUMP: EATON MODEL BB135 R, L - REMOVE AND INSTALL - BELT DRIVEN PUMP

step1.para: Disconnect both hoses at pump, taking care not to bend hoses any more than absolutely necessary. (With time and temperature exposure, hoses may take a "set" and will not have the flexibility of a new hose). When both hoses are disconnected, secure ends in raised position to prevent drainage of oil. Cover hose ends to avoid contamination of system.
Install caps at both pump fittings to prevent drainage of oil from pump.
Loosen pulley retaining bolt. Then loosen bracket mounting bolts to relieve belt tension.
If pump is to be disassembled, remove pump and mounting bracket as an assembly. If pump is not to be disassembled, the mounting bracket may remain attached to the engine.
If removed, re-install pump mounting bracket.
Position pump assembly on engine with holes lined up and install bolts loosely.
Install pulley. Insure that key remains in groove to avoid seal damage. Install pulley retaining bolt finger tight.
Fill reservoir. Bleed pump by turning pulley forward (clockwise as viewed from front) until air bubbles cease to appear.
Adjust belt tension and tighten pump mounting bolts to specifications in the TORQUE CHART. Refer to BELT TENSION. Also refer to GROUP 12 - COOLING in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
Tighten pulley retaining bolt to 20 ft-lbs. (27 Nm).
Bleed system. Refer to BLEED SYSTEM.
